As CATS works to keep buses operating for essential trips, we ask:
• Look for the yellow designated line to indicate 6’ from the operator. 
• Do NOT sit in the seats with an “X” on them. Look for markings on the floor to indicate seats that are 6’ apart

text:
A Message from The Guild of Transit Riders #11,

When we #rideCATS (or any neighboring transit system), the operators main functions are to: Drive bus, collect fare, get riders to destination in that order. Operators do not need to tinker around with Tannoy or reprimand riders.

text:
In 2013, over the howls of reactionaries who hate air conditioning and trains not made out of firewood, my city’s  government decided to remove from circulation what we’re at the time the oldest subway cars in use.

text_html: @CATSRideTransit the sprinter is a great option but it needs to be convenient if you want more travelers to make use. Accept cards not just exact change, give receipts for business travelers, more frequent buses from the airport (no one wants to get off a plane and wait 20 mins)
